availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Adaline R. Sublett Wand. Father of Thomas J. Wand, Mary E. Wand, William H. Wand, Benjamin Wand, Jr., Robert F. Wand, John M. Wand, Sarah E. Wand, Rachel A. Wand, Adaline Wand, Amanthis Wand, and Temple D. Wand. Farmer in Warren County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Warren County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Warren County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 38A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 2, p. 671.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 2, p. 453B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994057, Warren County Births.
"Benjamin Wand (1813-1878)," Find A Grave, Memorial 54628833, accessed September 28, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/54628833.
